results.title: Production Process
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, Kim Montgomery, Richard Greenhalgh and ACMI
results.brief_description: Sophie Byrne the producer leads the discussion in which the production process of ‘The Lost Thing’ is detailed from its very early stages until its completion some nine years later.

results.title: Vida Longa = Long Life
results.creator_credit: Vicki Banwell, Bertie Films and Channel 4
results.brief_description: Visually rich and culturally loaded, ‘Vida Longa’ is an intimate journey, a simple game, between one of the oldest and youngest Capoeira Masters in history.
results.description: Visually rich and culturally loaded, ‘Vida Longa’ is an intimate journey, a simple game, between one of the oldest and youngest Capoeira Masters in history.
description_for_label: Visually rich and culturally loaded, ‘Vida Longa’ is an intimate journey, a simple game, between one of the oldest and youngest Capoeira Masters in history.

results.title: Asking Around
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, Kim Montgomery, Richard Greenhalgh and ACMI
results.brief_description: Shaun Tan (author and co-director)describes some of his original concepts for the book of ‘The Lost Thing’ and how these were translated and changed for the film adaptation. Other interviewees Tom Bryant (3D artist)and Leo Baker (animator)discuss points of similarity and difference between the book and film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mike Kenneally, Kim Montgomery, Richard Greenhalgh and ACMI
results.description: Shaun Tan (author and co-director)describes some of his original concepts for the book of ‘The Lost Thing’ and how these were translated and changed for the film adaptation. Other interviewees Tom Bryant (3D artist)and Leo Baker (animator)discuss points of similarity and difference between the book and film.
description_for_label: Shaun Tan (author and co-director)describes some of his original concepts for the book of ‘The Lost Thing’ and how these were translated and changed for the film adaptation. Other interviewees Tom Bryant (3D artist)and Leo Baker (animator)discuss points of similarity and difference between the book and film.

results.title: The Lost Thing: character
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, Kim Montgomery, Richard Greenhalgh and ACMI
results.brief_description: ‘The Lost Thing’ production team discusses the challenges they faced creating the friendly and unthreatening character of the lost thing and the techniques used to convey emotion in a character that does not speak and has no facial features.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mike Kenneally, Kim Montgomery, Richard Greenhalgh and ACMI
results.description: ‘The Lost Thing’ production team discusses the challenges they faced creating the friendly and unthreatening character of the lost thing and the techniques used to convey emotion in a character that does not speak and has no facial features.
description_for_label: ‘The Lost Thing’ production team discusses the challenges they faced creating the friendly and unthreatening character of the lost thing and the techniques used to convey emotion in a character that does not speak and has no facial features.

results.title: Process V3
results.creator_credit: Chris Saunders, Karl Sadler, Juliette Larthe, Channel 4, Dazed and Confused and Prettybird
results.brief_description: Chris captured the dancers in Johannesburg. The edited material was then sent to Karl, who created the soundtrack using field recordings from his local neighbourhood of Brixton.
